RT2898-d-07-20-98-RT.Narrative: WITH ALL THE CREW MEMBERS IN THE CAB OF THE LOCOMOTIVE, CREW 221 WAS GOING TO PULL TWENTY-SEVEN CARSOF COKE FROM THE NORTH END OF TRACK B&O#1.  THE TWENTY-SIXTH AND TWENTY-SEVETH CARS WERE BEYOUND THE SOUTH END OF TRACK #1, FOULING TRACK B&O #2.  THE CREW TIED ON THE FRAG OF CARS AND BEGAN TO PULLNORTH, APPROXIMATELY TWO CAR LENGTHS.  THE ENGINEER STOPPED WHEN HE FELT A "TUG"IN THE DRAG.  SOMEONE HAD LINED THE SWITCH AT THE SOUTH END OF TRACK#1,FOR TRACK#2 UNDER THE TWENTY-SIXTH CAR. AS THE CREW PULLED THE DRAG NORTH THE LEAD TRUCK OF CAR 26 TRAVELLED DOWN TRACK#1, THE REAR TRUCK TRAVELLED DOWN TRACK#2, AND CAR 27 ALSO TTRAVELLED DOWN TRACK#2.  THE TWENTY-SIXTH CAR MOVING SIDEWAYS STRUCK ANOTHER COKE HOPPER THAT WAS ON TRACK#2, DERAILING CAR 25 IT WAS COUPLED TO, ITSELF,CAR 27, AND THE CAR ON TRACK#2. IT IS SUSPECTED SOMEONE FISHING ALONG THE RIVER , OR OTHER VANDALS, LINED THE SWITCHUNDER THE CAR. EQUIPMENT DAMAGE $15,000 / TRACK DAMAGE$7,727 / CRANE RENTAL #8,000NoneNoneNoneNoneNone

THE CONDUCTOR DROPPED OFF TO INSPECT THE TRAIN.  AFTER CONDUCTOR DISMOUNTED, THE TRAIN CONTINUED 2 CAR LENGTHS AND A TRAIN INITIATED EMERGENCY BRAKE APPLICATION OCCURRED.  INSPECTION REVEALED THAT THERE WERE IRREGULAR TRACK JOINTS AT POINT OF DERAILMENT.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone

98084-d-07-30-98-ARR.Narrative: TRAIN WAS PROCEEDING SOUTHWARD AT 10 MPH.  THE TRAIN BEGAN TO LOSE SPEED.  THE ENGINEER INCREASED THE THROTTLE POSITION AND REALIZED THE TRAIN WAS STILL LOSING SPEED.  THE ENGINEER BROUGHT THE THROTTLE TO IDLE.  THE TRAIN STOPPED. A TRAIN INITIATED EMERGENCY APPLICATION OF THE AIR BRAKES OCCURRED.INSPECTION REVEALED THE 36TH THROUGH 44TH CARS WERE DERAILED.NoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNoneNone
